alert.note: Alert for Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 10:38PM MDT until August 01 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Iron County in southern Utah... East Central Washington County in southwestern Utah... * Until 145 AM MDT. * At 1038 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the northwestern portions of Zion National Park. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, streams, and normally dry washes. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northwestern portions of Zion National Park including La Verkin Creek, Taylor Creek, and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
